title: compiling GCC on mac os x
body:
I'm trying to use spack on mac:
```uname -a
Darwin iMac-5K-Marcin.local 17.4.0 Darwin Kernel Version 17.4.0: Sun Dec 17 09:19:54 PST 2017; root:xnu-4570.41.2~1/RELEASE_X86_64 x86_64
```

I have 3 compilers installed on my system:
```spack compilers
==> Available compilers
-- clang highsierra-x86_64 --------------------------------------
clang@9.0.0-apple

-- gcc highsierra-x86_64 ----------------------------------------
gcc@7.3.0  gcc@4.9.0
```

I want to compile `gcc@7.3.0` with spack. I have tried `spack install gcc@7.3.0%gcc@7.3.0` and `spack install gcc@7.3.0%clang`. Both end in error during gcc compilation: 

When compiling using gcc: `/usr/include/sys/syslog.h:227:124: error: expected ',' or ';' before '__asm'`

When compiling using clang the error log is much longer:
```==> Error: ProcessError: Command exited with status 2:
    'make' '-j8' 'bootstrap'

19 errors found in build log:

               ormat_wanted_type>::allocate' requested here

                included from warning/Users/marcinpolkowski/spack/var/spack/sta

               mily/c-format.c:26:

               ng: using extended field designator is an extension [-Wextended-

               ect,
